title: [Self-Directed] Digital Game-Based Mathematical Inquiry Learning Design Workshop for Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theories (equations, statistics, geometry), experience with digital media, and basic programming skills (algorithm design)
context.additional_context: Enhancing competencies in designing math games for young children in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Collects measurable learning evidence (e.g., accuracy rates, response times) within games and utilizes them as analytical tools.

learning_goals: Design three learning objectives for early childhood math games based on the Dick & Carey model, reinforcing computational skills and problem-solving strategies

Learners apply four stages of R&D methodology (problem definition → idea sketching → algorithm design → prototype implementation) to develop and demonstrate one digital game prototype solving a given math problem (e.g., probability calculation, optimization problem) within a week, utilizing formula application and graph interpretation skills
Implement two early childhood learning effectiveness assessment tools via VR simulation, applying experimental design and data analysis methods

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
